alert.note: Alert for Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fremont County through 530 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Ocean Lake, which is also 11 miles north of Riverton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Fremont County, including the following locations... Midvale and Bonneville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.
